# pishow
pishow is a very simple program that allows you to render in console a fragment of a text file,</br> 
from a specific position, and a given size in bytes.

___
## Usage:

**go run pishow.go -i:inputFile [-from:position] [-size:blocksize]**

___

## Arguments explained:
**-i**:INPUTFILE. The path to filename</br>
**-from**: POSITION. The number of the byte to start the visualization. (Default is zero position). 
**-size**: BLOCKSIZE. The size of the block to visualize. (Default is 255 bytes)
___

## sample:
<span style="color:#fff; font-family: 'Courier'; font-size: 1.2em;">
go run pishow.go -i:/Volumes/Data/Pi/pi_dec_1t_01.txt -from:10000000000 -size:1024
</span>
<br>

___
This command shows **1024** digits of PI from the position **10GB**:
